ratings.comment: Underrated and funny professor. He made his expectations clear, though the exams were unnecessarily hard.

he did a good job of letting people know what he wanted students to learn and be able to do when he introduced new chapters. exams are unnecessarily calc heavy but theres always an easy question in each of them. he said he wouldnt curve but he did in the end. dont skip the review sessions he holds before exams

Tests are very heavy on calculus even though it is not taught at all. I know calc is a pre-req, but I haven't taken it in 3 years and the integrals given do not need to require integration by parts when simply setting up the integral correctly demonstrates a full understanding of what was taught in this class.
Gonzalos a very generous grader. The exam averages were trash but his curve was more than enough to help me pass the class. Decent teacher and tought me a lot. Would recommend him to any student.

WORST PROFESSOR IVE EVER TAKEN. Do yourself the favor and never get in the same class as him. It will make you contemplate your life. The class has a D average and he has no plan to curve. The class is disorganized, he puts solutions up super late, and the tests are super proof heavy. Worst class I've taken at UW
Bring ur pillow. Hes slower than anyone Ive ever met. Also, being a pillow for your pillow, cause thatll fall asleep too no questions asked.

Take him for Stats 312 if you can. He is a very easy grader. Its not difficult to get an A if you do the practice exams and relevant homework problems to prepare. You dont need to attend lecture, as he posts the lecture slides online. Copy the lecture slides down on your note sheet and the exams will be easy for you.
Funny and good teacher, but very short tempered and unorganized. Ask for help during office hours, he is more patient there than in class. Sometimes he'll just do homework problems for you.
Funny guy. The topics are boring but he keeps students engaged with random remarks and nonsensical comments. He is always willing to help inside or outside of office hours but can be moody and messy.

Gonzalo is a funny guy, but as a professor he is kind of unorganized and doesn't really care about teaching the course. Id say he might be a better option than some other math/stats professors though. The lectures can be very boring for 311 and the textbook doesn't help much. I learned so much more studying for exam P by myself following the course
Gonzalo is a grad student, not a professor, which is probably why this course was such a mess.  Material was not explained very well and homework was excessively long.

He is very straightforward about what he expects you to learn and what can you expect in evaluations. He tends to be very messy and unorganized, always needs to be reminded to upload homework to the class website. Textbook is not very useful but homework comes from it. Kinda hot too.

Gonzalo is one most odd people I have met but in a fantastic way. Relative to other Stats professors he's a great choice. Exams are difficult but not impossible, especially if you go to the review lectures. Whenever lecture starts to get dull he'll do some quirky thing that will grab your attention back. Take him if you can.
